title.rendered: The Most Perfect Bail from a Car In GTA History

content.rendered: Multiplayer modes in Grand Theft Auto 5 can be a little rough. Online, the game is mostly people running around and griefing other players with no mercy. A player in an attack helicopter or jet can really devastate the entire area and prevent other players from ever gaining a foothold. During one particular game, two players in this sedan were trying to outrun an attack chopper when it fired a few heat seeking missiles to bring them down. Once the player in the back knew they were doomed, he elected to try his luck jumping out of a moving car. The result was that he not only survived barely dodging both missiles as they annihilated the car, but he also got the opportunity to seek revenge on the helicopter!

title.rendered: Woman Causes Wreck, Immediately Goes into Denial

content.rendered: Apparently, someone told this driver that the best thing to do when in an accident is to immediately start denying that it was your fault…even when you pull out in front of another driver, and he has the entire thing on camera. Her next move is to then suggest that instead of calling the cops, they should exchange information. Russians aren’t the only ones that can use dashcams.

title.rendered: Koenigsegg CEO Races A Bugatti Against His CCXR

content.rendered: Christian von Koenigsegg, founder and CEO of Koenigsegg, goes behind the wheel in a showdown between the CCXR and a Bugatti Veyron on an old airstrip in Ängelholm, Sweden. But there’s a twist, Koenigsegg’s driving the Bugatti. Koenigsegg’s CEO was confident about the CCXR’s 4.7 L V-8 with 1,018 hp and 740 lb-ft of torque. However, even he wasn’t quite ready for the power from the Veyron’s 8.0-liter W-16 with 987 horsepower and 922 lb-ft of torque spread across four wheels. Watch his head snap back as he hits the gas.

title.rendered: 8 Ferraris, 2 Mecedes, 2 Lamborghinis, and 1 Huge Accident

content.rendered: It was a rough day for these sports car enthusiasts out for a day on the road in Japan. One of the Ferrari drivers collided with the median barrier while trying to change lanes. The following butterfly effect resulted in one of the most expensive pileups ever seen as driver after driver failed to avoid the growing accident.

title.rendered: How Moto GP Tires Work

content.rendered: There’s plenty of science and engineering that goes into automotive racing. Bridgestone has put together this video detailing how they design the Moto GP tires. These tires have to maintain a steadfast grip on the road through rapid acceleration, breaking and cornering all while collecting absurd levels of heat!

title.rendered: Evo Cuts Off Biker Then Suffers Immediate Karma

content.rendered: This biker was waiting to turn when this Evo came swooping in to cut him off. Karma follows. The driver of the Evo has such meek driving abilities that he manages to wipe out in an AWD car, on a straight stretch of road! It doesn’t even look like he tries to counter-steer his way out of it!

title.rendered: Not the Proper Way to Hook Up a Trailer

content.rendered:
Towing fails are pretty common on America’s roads and highways. We’ve all seen someone trying to pull far more than they ever should in a Honda Civic, or maybe they’re hauling a massive trailer with nothing tied down so all its contents spill out on the road. However, it’s a towing fail like this that’s a rare gem.

This Suburban tied up their trailer hitch to the wrong end of their camper trailer. The weight ratio between the SUV and the camper is all out of proportion. We wonder just how far they’ll get on their trip before realizing their mistake.

title.rendered: Ex-Wife Trashes Brand New Silverado

content.rendered:
We’re not certain what this guy did to piss his ex-wife off so badly, but it had to be awful! The crew at this body shop couldn’t help but document the brutality of her work. She keyed the entire outside of the truck and also covered the exterior and interior in white house paint. She also took keys to his 26″ D’Vinci rims, doused the interior and dash with oil, slashed the seats, trashed the radio, and dumped sugar in the gas tank!

Seriously, don’t piss your wife off.

title.rendered: Fastest Street Legal Dragster Makes History at 251 MPH

content.rendered: Driver Jeff Lutz made history on Day 1 of the 2015 Hot Rod Drag Week with the fastest street legal dragster ever. His Pro Mod 1969 street legal Camaro hit an astonishing 251 mph in 6.05s. This beats the 2014 record made by Tom Bailey at 6.542s seconds, and just barely tucks under Larry Larson’s unofficial pass at 6.16 seconds.

title.rendered: Twin Turbo Rear Engine Stretch Truck is a Drag Race Legend

content.rendered: Meet the longest truck bed in all of drag racing. This stretched out pickup is absolutely insane. The twin turbo big block mounted on the truck bed makes this monster leap off the starting line. It’s a good thing the engine is in the back or he’d be going through drive shafts like crazy.

title.rendered: Box Truck Does a Half Barrel Roll Down the Highway

content.rendered: The advent of the dashcam has given us a rare opportunity to see just how bad the drivers of the world truly are. This clip from Australia is no exception. The box truck swerves through traffic, drops items on the road, and ultimately loses control after colliding with a barrier. The dash cam owner’s commentary provides a fantastic play-by-play of the entire event.

title.rendered: Anger a Russian Motorist and They’ll Shoot Your Tires Out

content.rendered:
This dash cam starts after the altercation started. We see the guy from the front car run to his back seat. He comes back, swinging at the other car with a hatchet! At this point, we probably would have run this idiot over. Instead, he backs up.

That’s when the driver in front decides to return to his car but comes out brandishing a hand gun! He fires a few rounds in the tires of the car before taking off. Unbelievable!

title.rendered: Jeep Chief Concept is an Incredible Throwback!

content.rendered: Recent Jeep designs have left us feeling a little underwhelmed. We thoroughly miss the older, vintage look of 70’s era Jeeps. Mark Allen, the head of Jeep design, is here show-off the the beautiful throwback design of the new Jeep Safari. It’s got the classic two door body along with a 3.6-liter V6. It also has a 6 speed manual transmission. This 4X4 is going to turn tons of heads, including ours!

title.rendered: Watch This Idiot Shoot His Own Truck

content.rendered: This genius took one look at his truck and thought “hey, the roof would be a great gun rest if I sat in the bed!” This may have been true for some shooters, but not this special individual. The real question is, why didn’t the cameraman try to stop him?

title.rendered: This $6M Ford F750 is an RV in a Pickup Truck

content.rendered: With a $6 million price tag, this may be the world’s most expensive Ford Super Duty F750. It started off with all the basic package, a 6.7 L inline 6 cylinder turbocharged engine with 385 hp and 1,200 lb-ft of torque, but that’s where the standard options end. This wonder was a personal project made by Peter Dunkel of Dunkel Industries. It features a full kitchen, bathroom, dining room, living room with enough space for 6 people, AND it can still carry 4 tons of cargo in the truck bed. Dunkel is clearly going to be the tailgate king this football season.

category.name: Luxury
category.description: The finer things in life sometimes come to us on four wheels. If you like your cars to have a silver spoon in their grills, these are the stories for you.

title.rendered: Karma Punishes Harassing Redneck Driver

content.rendered: Florida Man is at it again. This time it was a guy in a truck who was tailgating and harassing a woman driving. He pulls up alongside her and shoots her the finger for a rather long time. She starts to get it all on film while he’s still giving her grief. Then, in an attempt to look hardcore, he pulls out ahead, cuts her off and starts drifting his truck everywhere. The best part is when he fails to maintain control and drives off the road and crashes! Perfect karma!

title.rendered: Hondas Are Falling Out of the Sky

content.rendered: This footage came from a practice session at the 2014 Pike’s Peak International Hill Climb. Jeff Grace was riding when a Honda dirt bike came tumbling down the mountain. He tried to stop in time but still wound up wrecking.

title.rendered: Dubai Cop in Lykan Hypersport Pulls Over a Lamborghini Aventador

content.rendered: When someone asks you how rich the city of Dubai is, all you need to do is show them this video. Only in Dubai, where the police force is known for the fleet of Bugatti Veyron “patrol” cars, would you find a police-operated Lykan Hypersport pulling over a Lamborghini Aventador…sporting a flaming exhaust!

title.rendered: Cop Lays Down HOV Justice

content.rendered:
Don’t you hate it when you see people cheating in the HOV lane, abusing the honor code and clogging that traffic when they don’t have any additional passengers in their car? Whenever we see someone do that, we hope there’s a cop around the corner to bust them. That’s exactly why this video is so awesome! This SUV sees the cop and tries to merger back in the regular lane, but it’s too late!

You have to give a cop credit who has no fears about stepping out in front of a car on the highway to dole out a ticket!

title.rendered: GTA 5 Fast & Furious Drag Scene

content.rendered: Remember that incredible ending to the first Fast and the Furious movie when Dom races his 1973 Charger against Brian’s 1993 Toyota? Remember when they gun it at the last second to clear the tracks before the train plows through them? Some incredibly patient Grand Theft Auto player has re-shot the entire end sequence.

title.rendered: Stuck in a Parking Spot?

content.rendered: Don’t you hate it when you parallel park and come back to find two other cars on you, bumper-to-bumper? This guy is obviously sick of it and decides to handle it, for real!

title.rendered: Real Life Transformer From Mercedes

content.rendered: The Mercedes-Benz Concept IAA is two cars in one, literally. This Intelligent Aerodynamic Automobile is a real life transformer with moving front flaps, tail extension, bumper, and rims that can be adjusted from within the cabin, mid-ride. With a touch of a button, the driver can go from a four door coupé to an aerodynamic wonder built for luxurious speed.

title.rendered: Bugatti’s Video Game Concept Car Has Become Reality

content.rendered: The Bugatti concept car that thrilled fans in Gran Turismo has just become real. This streamlined luxury super sports car made its real-life debut on Volkswagen Group Night at the 2015 IAA Frankfurt Motor Show. The debut was complete with some fantastic stage tricks that made it appear to be racing along the virtual tracks of Gran Turismo. This concept was built with a singular purpose, to dominate the French Le Mans race track with luxury and style. It’s doubtful that this beauty will grace anything more than a concept show room, but at least its glory can finally be witnessed in the physical world.
